title: Returns Are a Headache. More Retailers Are Saying, Just ‘Keep It.’
excerpt: In a survey, nearly 60 percent of retailers said they had policies that refund customers for items that aren’t financially viable to send back.
highlights:
Highlight:Fifty-nine percent of retailers have keep-it policies for items that aren’t financially viable to ship back, according to a 2023 survey on holiday shopping trends by goTRG, now called ReturnPro, a firm that helps retailers including Walmart manage returns. Most companies don’t advertise the policy prominently.

Highlight:for every $1 billion in sales, the average retailer sustained $145 million in returns.

Highlight:About 64 percent of items that were eligible for such returns cost less than $20,

Highlight:83 percent were under $30.
